Players start with the board arranged as shown in picture 1. Each player’s stones are in random order. Person playing with light stones starts.

Each turn starts with rolling a die. Then player must move their matching stone. If it’s no longer on the board, the player must move remaining stone whose number is next-highest or next-lowest to the one shown by the die.
Player may move their stone only one cell to their up, left or diagonal up-left (picture 2).
If a stone lies already on the target cell, it’s removed from the board (picture 3).
If there’s only one of player’s stones remaining on the board, there’s no need to roll the die—the stone is automatically selected.
Game ends when:\n- a player gets one of their stones to the far corner where their opponent started, or\n- all opponent’s stones are removed from the board.
